channel.title: Buying an electric guitar
channel.description:
Hello! Right now I have my acoustic guitar which I'm quite satisfied with, but I thought an electric one could be a nice addition to my small 'collection', if you will. The problem is that I'm hopeless when it comes to electric guitars: what's good, what's bad, I don't know anything. I'll have around 300€ in a couple months so the budget for both the guitar AND the amp will most likely be no more than 300€.
So yeah :P make suggestions on what I should buy and what shouldn't etc.
(I'd also prefer if the guitar and the amp would be in the same package so that I wouldn't have to buy them separately)

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @XharveyX XharveyX
item.description:
@XharveyX wrote:

ebay it. I come from a family of musicians, i myslef am i guitarist and we have found great offered on ebay such as great quality guitars like takamines for like £200-300 worth £500+

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

When u can afford, Gibson is da way to go. Thick necks r da best!!

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ive never seen that yamaha irl but from my experience the cheaper yamaha guitars are way better instruments than the cheaper squier guitars

that said i kinda like my squier for wht it is

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

i recommend this
http://cgi.ebay.ca/Ibanez-RG320FM-Excellent-electric-guitar-RG-320-FM_W0QQitemZ350227771385QQcmdZViewItemQQptZGuitar?hash=item518b33aff9
just because i want one

tbh, just buy something you’re comfortable with and like how it looks
definitely try it out at a music store before buying

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:7, topic:330012”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=426401.msg3132103#msg3132103 date=1266598156]
Just an idea I pulled out of my arse: What if you buy the cheapest guitar you can find, and stick in the best pickups you can find within your budget?
[/quote]

The quality will be shit though. Maybe not sound but the playing quality.

There is a huge difference in playing my old ass beginner guitar and my Les Paul.

The action is weird (I’ve adjusted it plenty), the fretboard is not comfortable, it’s just awkward.[/quote]

Yea I put seymour duncans in my iceman which I got for 300 but even so it can’t compare to my Gibson Les Paul. But go to a guitar shop and play the ones in your range and find one that feels good, then worry about whether it sounds good.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Yeah, I’d be more concerned about action and tuning than pickups at this point. However if you play acoustic guitar right now, you’ll probably have a hard time finding an electric guitar with worse action.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Just an idea I pulled out of my arse: What if you buy the cheapest guitar you can find, and stick in the best pickups you can find within your budget?

The quality will be shit though. Maybe not sound but the playing quality.

There is a huge difference in playing my old ass beginner guitar and my Les Paul.

The action is weird (I’ve adjusted it plenty), the fretboard is not comfortable, it’s just awkward.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

cheap guitars are good to learn on, but if you’re looking for quality ur gunna have to spend more

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

What you think of this for 300€?

YAMAHA ERG-121
-2xHumb/1xsinglecoil-microphones
-GA-15amp, 15W, two channels, headphone hole (?)
-YT-100 tuner machine
-bag
-cords
-strap
-strings, plectras

lol wtf I have no idea what it means. What’s the difference in watts regarding the amps? The more watts the louder sound or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Getting a guitar/amp combo generally means you will end up with both a lower quality guitar and amplifier, since they’re usually meant for absolute beginners.

Take a look at Squire/Fender Stratocasters, a lot of people say they’re shit but I’ve owned one for years and it probably has everything you need in a guitar.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying an electric guitar
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

afaik when you’re not looking to spend much there isn’t a whole lot of choice (or difference in choices) unless you find a specific model and go out of your way to find a store that sells it.

You get what you pay for - just go to a reputable store and tell them how much you want to spend.

Read full topic
